settings.text: Give customers details about the banner image(s) or content on the template.

settings.title: Which facial would be best for me to book?
settings.text: All of our facials are customized specifically for you. We recommend if its your first time, to get started with the "Back To The Basics" Facial. This will allow us to get to know you and your skin and what treatment plan you will need to get you results. The difference between the facials is that the ParTouch has a range of different treatments/modalities that can be done to treat your skin as well as enhance your results, and it allots more time to spend on nourishing your skin.

settings.title: Is it ok to wear makeup to my facial appointment?
settings.text: We recommend coming bare face to your appointment. Depending on how much makeup you have on it can take away from your facial service. While we do understand that life can be pretty busy, rest assured that we are able to remove it for you.

settings.title: Is there anything I should do to prepare for my facial?
settings.text: We recommend stopping any active treatments, exfoliants, and sensitizing serums that are being used at home at least four days before your appointment.

settings.title: I'm breaking out after my facial, is that normal?
settings.text: It is normal to have what we call “purging” after a facial or starting a new product or supplement. The skin will often show us what's happening on the inside so if there is an imbalance or congestion in the skin, then the skin will purge. If the breakouts continue to come about, please reach out to us for assistance.

settings.title: There are so many supplements to choose from, how do I know which one will be the best for me?
settings.text: You are more than welcome to always email us any questions that you may have regarding the supplements, and we can help you choose which ones would best fit your lifestyle.

settings.title: I am taking medications prescribed by my doctor, can I still take the supplements?
settings.text: While most of our supplements are natural, we always recommend talking to your doctor first to make sure the supplements are suitable for you to take.

settings.title: I want to get waxed, how long does my hair have to be?
settings.text: We strongly recommend having 2-3 weeks of hair growth to achieve the best wax. The hair should be ¼” long or longer.

settings.title: Is there anything that I should do in preparation for my wax?
settings.text: Exfoliation and moisturizing is always key. We recommend exfoliating 3-4 times a week and stopping the exfoliation two days before your appointment, and moisturizing everyday. You can always schedule to come by and shop for some of our favorite waxing products before your service.

settings.title: Can I get waxed on my period?
settings.text: There will be more sensitivity when on your menstrual cycle, but you are welcome to come and get waxed. In order to be serviced you will however have to have a tampon inserted.

settings.title: I haven't received my order yet, what should I do?
settings.text: Although you may receive your order before this time, it typically takes 7 business days of processing and 3-4 days to ship.

settings.large_footnote: If you do not see your question mentioned above please contact us for assistance, and we will be more than happy to answer any of your questions. Please allow 24-72hrs for a response.
